channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9494] Cleanup inconsistencies in protobuf message and rpc names
item.description:
This is a minor cleanup of some inconsistencies in names of protobuf messages and rpcs. I ran into these while dynamically working with hbase-protocol, where it is nice to have message and rpc names as consistent as possible. Specifically, most of these changes are to have the rpc name match the message names plus [Request, Response]. Changes:

Message renames:
AccessControlProtos.UserPermissions[Request, Response] -> GetUserPermissions[Request, Response]
AggregateProtos.AggregateArgument -> AggregateRequest
AuthenticationProtos.Token[Request, Response] -> GetAuthenticationToken[Request, Response]
AuthenticationProtos.Token[Request, Response] -> GetAuthenticationToken[Request, Response]
MultiRowMutation.MultiMutate[Request, Response] -> MutateRows[Request, Response]
RowProcessorProtos.RowProcessor[Request, Response] -> ProcessRowRequest[Request, Response]
SecureBulkLoadProtos.DelegationTokenProto -> DelegationToken

RPC renames:
MasterAdminProtos.RunCatalogScan -> CatalogScan
MasterAdminProtos.Snapshot -> TakeSnapshot
MasterAdminProtos.GetCompletedSnapshots -> ListCompletedSnapshots
RowProcessorProtos.Process -> RowProcessorProtos.ProcessRow

Outer classname changes:
MultiRowMutation -> MultiRowMutationProtos
Tracing -> TracingProtos

File renames:
hbase.proto -> HBase.proto
item.summary: Cleanup inconsistencies in protobuf message and rpc names

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Excellent. Thanks Dan Burkert Convertion was done by a bunch of us independently, disjointly, over time, so thanks for fixing our different takes on how stuff should be named aligning it all. The only issue I have w/ the patch is your rename of methods that are already available in 0.94; for these can you add the new method deprecating the old (have old call the new?). I see the snapshot methods in particular as the problem here (they seem to be the only methods that were in 0.94 changed by this patch).

stack, I can certainly do that. Alternatively, I can change the name of the rpc back to what it was originally and rename the request and response message names to match. For example:

MasterAdminProtos.RunCatalogScan will use RunCatalogScan[Request, Response] instead of CatalogScan[Request, Response]

MasterAdminProtos.Snapshot will use Snapshot[Request, Response] instead of TakeSnapshot[Request, Response]

etc.

Let me know which you prefer.

Disturbing the public APIs as little as possible is probably best at this late stage in the 0.96 game... so your leaving the methods as is and changing pb to match looks good.

St.Ack

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12602424/HBASE-9494.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 24 new or modified tests.

-1 hadoop1.0. The patch failed to compile against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7129//console

This message is automatically generated.

New patch removes all changes to rpcs, instead changing request and response message names. Changes:

Message renames:
AccessControlProtos.UserPermissions[Request, Response] -> GetUserPermissions[Request, Response]
AggregateProtos.AggregateArgument -> AggregateRequest
AuthenticationProtos.Token[Request, Response] -> GetAuthenticationToken[Request, Response]
MasterAdminProtos.CatalogScan[Request, Response] -> RunCatalogScan[Request, Response]
MasterAdminProtos.TakeSnapshot[Request, Response] -> Snapshot[Request, Response]
MasterAdminProtos.ListSnapshot[Request, Response] -> GetCompletedSnapshots[Request, Response]
MultiRowMutation.MultiMutate[Request, Response] -> MutateRows[Request, Response]
RowProcessorProtos.RowProcessor[Request, Response] -> Process[Request, Response]
SecureBulkLoadProtos.DelegationTokenProto -> DelegationToken

Outer classname changes:
MultiRowMutation -> MultiRowMutationProtos
Tracing -> TracingProtos

File renames:
hbase.proto -> HBase.proto

Retry just to make sure test failure is unrelated.

I took a look at the patch. Looks good to me. I did a double-take at first where the return is changed on a public API but the return is a pb and we haven't shipped a release w/ pb yet so we good. Waiting on hadoopqa result. Will commit on morrow unless objection (another pair of eyes appreciated)
